---
title: Student-t model
---

Also called robust regression.

Model:

$$
\begin{align}
y_i \sim \text{StudentT}(\nu, \mu_i, \sigma) \\
\mu_i = \alpha + \beta \cdot x_i
\end{align}
$$

Parameters needing priors:

- $\alpha$ (intercept)
- $\beta$ (predictor weights)
- $\sigma$ (observation model standard deviation)
- $\nu$ (degrees of freedom)

Data:

- $y$ (continuous outcome)
- $x$ (predictors)


# Gamma prior

Analysed by [@juarezModelBasedClusteringNonGaussian2010].

$$
\nu \sim \text{gamma}(2, .01)
$$
